intro: Psychotria pachyphylla, commonly known as the thick-leaved psychotria, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. The plant is characterized by its thick, leathery leaves and clusters of small, white to greenish flowers. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in rainforests. Psychotria pachyphylla is also noted for its chemical composition, which includes various alkaloids.
